required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Oral Gimatecan in Platinum-Resistant Epithelial Ovarian, Fallopian Tube or Peritoneal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study of Gimatecan in the Treatment of Platinum-resistant Recurrent Epithelial Ovarian, Fallopian Tube or Peritoneal Cancer

brief_summary.textblock:
This phase II clinical trial studies the safety and effect of Gimatecan in patients with platinum-resistant recurrent epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube or peritoneal cancer.
The chemotherapy will be given every four weeks.This study is a single-arm, multi-center research design.

detailed_description.textblock: The study had 3 phases: screening phase, treatment phase and follow-up phase. During the treatment phase, the drug will continue to be administered until the progression of disease, complete remission , unacceptable toxicity.

primary_outcome.time_frame: To evaluate objective response rate every 8 weeks after the initiation of chemotherapy, up to 24 months.
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with objective response assessed by best overall response (BOR) and independent review committee （IRC） of either complete response(CR) or partial remission(PR) will be reported.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of death from any cause or the date of first documented disease progression whichever came first, assessed up to 24 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The 2-year progression free survival of the whole group.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: To evaluate disease control rate every 8 weeks after the initiation of chemotherapy, up to 24 months.
From date of randomization until the date of death from any cause or the date of last follow-up whichever came first, assessed up to 24 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The 2-year overall survival of the whole group.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of death from any cause or the date of last follow-up whichever came first, assessed up to 24 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The 2-year overall survival of the whole group.

arm_group.description: In Phase II study, patients will receive gimatecan at fixed dose level (0.8mg/m2/d, oral, every 4 weeks) until progressive disease (PD)、complete remission（CR）).

intervention.description: Patients will receive gimatecan orally at the fixed dose level on day 1-5 every 4 weeks.

results_reference.citation: Hurwitz JL, McCoy F, Scullin P, Fennell DA. New advances in the second-line treatment of small cell lung cancer. Oncologist. 2009 Oct;14(10):986-94. doi: 10.1634/theoncologist.2009-0026. Epub 2009 Oct 9. Review.

clinical_study.keyword: epithelial ovarian, fallopian tube or peritoneal cancer
